instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> strange battery problem
threads.message: Hey, first at all customer came to battery replacement, and now after changing it he comes back and battery seems dead, changed again new battery. worked 1 week and again dead, same problem is now 4 time in row, worked 1 week and battery dead. Where to find fault ? the batteries were different places ordered.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> strange battery problem
threads.message:
Board works correctly without battery connected?
What is exact <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> voltage (no battery)?
Check diode mode to ground and voltage on SCL/SDA lines of battery bus.
Be sure battery connector has no broken pins (onboard).
